news.title: Manica Diamonds seek to mount strong title challenge this season
news.content:
Story by Kenias Chivuzhe
MANICA Diamonds are seeking to continue their winning streak as they date FC Platinum in a Castle Lager Premier Soccer League encounter at Mandava Stadium this Saturday.
For the first time in three seasons, the Gem Boys managed to win their first match of the season after overcoming Yadah one-nil at Sakubva Stadium last week.
The arrival of Ghanaian attacker, Emmanuel Paga and winger Issa Sadiki from Dynamos, and the duo of Ransom Pavari and Lawrence Mhlanga from FC Platinum has given the Gems Boys hope.
“The win against Yadah FC is giving us more energy to continue producing positive results. We have a setback where Liberty Masvaure had a fracture while Ransom Pavari has an angle injury. We have players to fill up the positions as we aim for a win.
“Our team is very strong in defense as we have our goalkeeper Tedious Baye, and defenders who include Lawrence Mhlanga, Farai Banda, Ask Rupande, Chipo Tsodzo among others. In the past two seasons, we were failing to win the first game of the season but this time around we have managed to win. This gives us hope to have a good season as we aim to be champions. We ended last season on number four and we want to improve from that position to finish on number one or two,” Manica Diamonds Head Coach, Jairos Tapera said.
The Mutare-based outfit will miss the services of utility Rainsome Pavari who joined from FC Platinum this year, while defender Liberty Masvaure is also nursing a fracture.
Manica Diamond fans are optimistic of a good season but warned their team against complacency when they face FC Platinum.
“We are happy with the team but there is need to improve on our attacking department. We need to score goals and we have a tough game with FC Platinum away. We need to play offensive football to win the match,” a football supporter said.

news.title: Simba Bhora commended for transforming Wadzanai Stadium
news.content:
Story by Tapiwa Machemedze
THE 2024 Premier Soccer League champions, Simba Bhora have been commended by government for being exemplary in the refurbishment of Wadzanai Stadium and being one of the few teams outside Harare and Bulawayo to win the Premier Soccer League.
The stadium, rehabilitated following a long lease given by Chaminuka Rural District Council, has become an example of public-private partnerships that should be emulated.
This was said by the Permanent Secretary for Sports, Recreation, Arts and Culture, Mr Nicholas Moyo during a tour of the stadium.
“One of the key deliverables of the Ministry of Sports is infrastructural development, and one of my reason for being here is to appreciate the status of infrastructure. We are looking at the possibility of what we have seen here and taking it to other local authorities and encouraging them to go into PPPs. Government is already supportive, it brings in technical partners and expertise to ensure that we up our game,” he said.
The Simba Bhora family thanked government for the recognition of being pace setters.

news.title: FC Platinum and Simba Bhora clash in Uhuru Cup
news.content:
Story by Lawrence Trusida, Sports Editor
EMERGING forces FC Platinum and Simba Bhora will clash for this year’s Uhuru Cup when the country celebrates 45 years of independence at Nembudziya Grounds in Gokweon April 18.
As part of the Second Republic’s thrust to decentralise national events, the Uhuru Cup will be played in the Midlands Province for the first time in its 44-year history.
The top two teams from last year, champions Simba Bhora and runners-up FC Platinum will clash for the Uhuru Cup this year.
The two clubs are emerging forces within the domestic football circles, with FC Platinum having won four titles in the last six years, while Simba Bhora are the defending PSLchampions.
In a Post Cabinet Media Briefing in Harare this Tuesday,Information, Publicity and Broadcasting Services Minister Dr Jenfan Muswere announced the exciting development.
“Simba Bhora and FC Platinum football clubs will entertain the crowds during the main Independence Day anniversary celebrations, while Herentals Queens and Black Rhinos Football Clubs will play as the first and second-placed teams in the Premier League during the 2025 Children’s Party celebrations.”
Just like what happened in Mt Darwin and Murambinda when the independence celebrations were hosted there, Nembudziya will also have legacy projects, with a football pitch and other amenities set to be constructed.

news.title: Bindura to receive major sports boost with construction of new stadium
news.content:
Story by Tapiwa Machemedze
AN Olympic-size stadium is set to be established in Bindura as part of the National Sports Academy (NSA) which was mooted by the Second republic.
The Bindura University of Science Education (BUSE) is chasing a three-year target for the construction of an Olympic-size stadium in line with its mandate of housing the national sports academy.
BUSE’s Vice Chancellor, Professor Eddie Mwenje announced a golf tournament will be held in Harare on 14 March to help complement efforts by Treasury and the Ministry of Higher and Tertiary Education in fundraising for the ambitious project.
“Buse was chosen by the government to house the NSA so that we could assist the nation in sports development, talent identification and grooming of talent and that’s the reason why we are having this golf tournament on 14 March.  The NSA is not an ordinary facility, we have to have an Olympic standard tartan track, an Olympic standard swimming pools and everything has to be to the standard therefore, the nation has to rally behind this important facility.”
The initiative has come at a time BUSE is celebrating 25 years of existence with students and businesses pledging to contribute to the important establishment.

news.title: Giants CAPS United host new boys Scottland at Rufaro
news.content:
Story by Lawrence Trusida, Sport Editor
THEclash between CAPS United and Scottland FC set for Sunday at Rufaro stadium will headline the Castle Lager Premier Soccer League matchday two programme.
A mouth-watering clash is looming, with giants CAPS United hosting an expensively assembled side, Scottland at Rufaro Stadium on Sunday in arguably the match of the second round.
CAPS United picked up a point from their encounter against Green Fuel after coming from behind to force a one-all draw.
Scottland on the other hand had the perfect start, collecting maximum points against Triangle after a defensive mix-up gave them a one-nil victory on the stroke of full-time.
The two sides were very active in the transfer marketwith Makepekepe bolstering theirsquad with a few key playersthat includegoalkeeper Stephen Kwakuof Ghanaand midfielders Juan Mutudza and Tanaka Shandirwa.
On the other hand, Scottland had a total makeover from the team that was playing in Division One and among their top acquisitionsis2024 Soccer Star of the Year, Walter Musona, top goal scorer, Lynoth Chikuhwa and Khama Billiat.
The match will also see enterprising midfielder Kingsley Mureremba and utility defender Godknows Murirwa facing their former paymasters for the first time since leaving the former champions.
PSL action however starts on Friday with Yadah hosting Chicken Inn at the Heart stadium, with both sides seeking their first win of the season after being held in their opening day matches.
Saturday sees FC Platinum taking on Manica Diamonds in a potentially explosive encounter at Mandava Stadium, ambitious TelOne date Triangle at Ascot Stadium in Gweru, whileBikita Minerals welcome MWOS to Sakubva Stadium.
ZPC Kariba host defending champions, Simba Bhora at Nyamhungastadiumwhile Herentals take on Dynamos at Rufaro Stadium.
Action continues on Sunday when Highlanders host league debutants Kwekwe United at Barbourfields Stadium.
